availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William McClure (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, farmer and sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Eliza McClure. Father of John McClure, Josiah McClure, Ezekiel McClure, Green McClure, George McClure, and Martha McClure. Married to Amilda McClure. Farmer in Rockcastle County in 1850. Sheriff of Rockcastle County from 1863 and 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Southern District, p. 168; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Rockcastle County, Mt. Vernon, p. 12; Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, Passed at the Adjourned Session (January, 1865) Which Was Begun and Held in the City of Frankfort, on Monday, the Seventh Day of December, 1863 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, 1865), ch. 793, p. 170; KYR-0001-029-0527; KYR-0001-004-1335; KYR-0001-004-0215; KYR-0001-004-0387; KYR-0001-004-0567.
